newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Caniel sets up Jordan venture.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Caniel sets up Jordan venture.

text.p: Caniel Israel Can Co. Ltd and a Jordanian unnamed, publicly traded investment company will set up a joint factory in Irbid, Jordan, at a total investment of $6 million, Caniel said in a statement.
The factory, Caniel's first abroad, will be established in equal partnership between the sides and will produce metal packaging for food based on Caniel's technology and knowhow.

The Jordanian factory is expected to serve as a bridge to other Arab countries, the Israeli company said and is part of Caniel's strategy to enlarge its markets and its activities in Israel and abroad.

Caniel managing director Eli Admoni said the new factory would not supply Israel. The annual sales turnover from the new factory is forecast at $9 million, as of 1998. The factory is expected to start operations in a year.
Caniel is a leading local supplier of metal packaging for the processed, canned foods and drinks industries. Sales in the first half of the year reached 137 million shekels.
Caniel is a publicly traded company whose main shareholders are Discount Investment Corp and the Ellern-Migdal Investment Group.
